main event: The report describes several sightings of unusual aerial objects in the Beloit, Wisconsin and Morengo, Illinois area between August 19, 1955 and August 6, 1955.
interesting points: The objects were described as round, bright white and red, varying in size from three times the size of a baseball to a pinpoint, and appearing to spin.
The objects moved erratically, going straight then making sharp turns, tilting on their sides, and disappearing into the daylight.
The objects were reported to make no sound, but emitted a low humming sound like an electric motor.
Multiple witnesses reported the sightings, including a chief of police, GOC observers, and a civilian.
Investigations by the Air Force, including checking for meteors, jet aircraft, and weather conditions, were unable to conclusively identify the objects.
sighted object: round, bright white and red objects of varying sizes
witnesses: chief of police, GOC observers, civilian
photographs: yes, the report indicates photographs were taken
